home.title: Memory, childhood and migration that transform the present
home.subtitle: We accompany migration processes through care, words, and community. We create safe spaces where stories are recognized, childhood is protected, and migrant women lead change.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Preserve, care for and transmit the identity memory of migrant children. Make visible and strengthen the history of migrant women as cultural agents, caregivers and sustainers of memory. Offer spaces of emotional, social and cultural sustainability that foster resilience and positive roots from childhood.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: Promote cultural diversity, intergenerational dialogue and community participation. Build networks of support, training and action that contribute to the symbolic repair of migrant memory, denouncing any form of violence, exclusion or discrimination towards migrant children and their families.

values.title: Our Values
values.transparencyDesc: Preserve and transmit the identity memory of migrant children as the basis of their development
values.commitmentDesc: Promote intergenerational dialogue and community participation from respect for diversity
values.solidarityDesc: Foster positive roots and belonging from childhood, building spaces of emotional sustainability

help.title: How can you help?
help.donateDesc: Your contribution makes our projects possible
help.spreadDesc: Share our cause on your social networks

about.title: About Origina
about.description: ORIGINA – MEMORIA E INFANCIA EN MOVIMIENTO is a non-profit association established under Organic Law 1/2002, which develops its activities mainly in the Canary Islands, extending its action to the rest of Spain and cooperating in supranational or international programs.

mission.title: Mission
mission.description: Our mission focuses on preserving, caring for and transmitting the identity memory of migrant children; making visible and strengthening the history of migrant women as cultural agents, caregivers and sustainers of memory; and offering spaces of emotional, social and cultural sustainability that foster resilience, positive roots and belonging from childhood.

vision.title: Vision
vision.description: Promote cultural diversity, intergenerational dialogue and community participation. Build networks of support, training and action that contribute to the symbolic repair of migrant memory, aligning our actions with the Sustainable Development Goals of the 2030 Agenda.

values.title: Values
values.description: Our fundamental values are the preservation of identity memory, respect for cultural diversity, promotion of intergenerational dialogue, building community support networks, denouncing violence and discrimination, and commitment to transparency and sustainability.

history.title: Our History
history.description: ORIGINA was established as a non-profit association with the purpose of preserving and transmitting the identity memory of migrant children, recognizing the fundamental role of migrant women as cultural agents and caregivers of memory. We work from the Canary Islands with a participatory and community approach, developing projects that strengthen positive roots and belonging from childhood.

contact.title: Contact us
contact.subtitle: We are here to help you. Send us a message and we will respond as soon as possible.
contact.name: Name
contact.subject: Subject

projects.title: Our Projects
projects.subtitle: Learn about our projects dedicated to preserving the identity memory of migrant children and strengthening their positive roots

items.title: Community We Who Migrate (NQM)
items.description: First Digital Living Memory Archive of the Paraguayan migration process: a collective space that brings together voices, bodies and stories that were historically silenced. It is not a static repository, it is a memory in motion that is updated with each testimony. A tool for dignification, transmission and future built by migrants themselves.
items.fullDescription: Community We Who Migrate was born as an initiative promoted by the NGO Origina Memory and Childhood in Movement, founded by Ana Paniagua T., from a trajectory committed to memory, childhood, identity and community processes. NQM is built from the real and collective experience of migrant women who sustain lives, families, work and communities in contexts of uprooting, inequality and silencing. It is not an assistance project. It is a project of conscious empowerment, living memory and collective action.
items.mission: Accompany, strengthen and make visible migrant women.
items.vision: Transform the migrant experience into an engine of social change.
items.scope: Migrant women (educational, social, cultural and community)
items.organization: NGO Origina Memory and Childhood in Movement
items.license: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution – Non Commercial – No Derivatives (CC BY-NC-ND). Commercial use and creation of derivative works are not permitted without express authorization from the author

items.title: Migrant Doula Course
items.description: Course to train conscious, culturally sensitive companions with a human rights approach, capable of accompanying births and migration processes with awareness, rights and community.
items.fullDescription: Migrant women go through processes of motherhood, childbirth and parenting in contexts of uprooting, language barriers, cultural clashes and, in many cases, violation of rights. The Migrant Doula Course was born to train conscious, culturally sensitive companions with a human rights approach. The course uses popular education methodology, experiential approach, real testimonies, reflective and practical work.
items.mission: Train doulas with a migrant perspective capable of accompanying women and families in migration contexts in an ethical, empathetic and professional manner.
items.vision: Accompany births and migration processes with awareness, rights and community.
items.methodology: Popular education, experiential approach, real testimonies, reflective and practical work.
objectives: Understand the migration experience and its emotional and bodily impact
Provide practical tools for prenatal, birth and postpartum accompaniment
items.beneficiaries: Migrant women, community activists, birth companions, educators, caregivers and people interested in respectful accompaniment
items.modality: Online course with live meetings, downloadable materials and community accompaniment
items.certification: Participation certificate issued by Origina – Memory and Childhood in Movement
items.organization: NGO Origina – Memory and Childhood in Movement
items.license: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution – Non Commercial – No Derivatives (CC BY-NC-ND). Commercial use and creation of derivative works are not permitted without express authorization from the author

cta.title: Do you want to collaborate with our projects?
cta.description: Your support makes it possible for these projects to continue transforming lives and preserving the memory of migrant children

workshops.title: Workshops
workshops.subtitle: Creative spaces to strengthen identity memory
workshops.description: Our workshops are designed to accompany migrant children and their families in strengthening their cultural and emotional identity. Each workshop incorporates mutual care practices, emotional sustainability and respect for cultural diversity.

forChildren.title: Workshops for Migrant Children
forChildren.subtitle: Safe spaces for creative expression and memory

workshops.title: Narrative Photography and Visual Memory
workshops.description: Workshop where children and adolescents learn to tell their stories through photography, creating a visual archive of their migrant memory and strengthening their cultural identity.

workshops.title: Identity Embroidery and Cultural Symbols
workshops.description: Through embroidery, participants express their cultural identity, creating pieces that represent their roots, traditions and family memory.

workshops.title: Word Circles
workshops.description: Intergenerational dialogue spaces where family stories, migration experiences and community knowledge are shared, strengthening bonds between generations.

workshops.title: Cooperative Games and Belonging
workshops.description: Playful activities that promote teamwork, cooperation and sense of belonging to the community, creating positive bonds between participants.

workshops.title: Migrant Stories and Community Narrators
workshops.description: Workshop for creating and narrating stories where migration stories are made visible, strengthening collective memory and the role of women as community narrators.

training.title: Training and Awareness
training.subtitle: Training for professionals and community agents

workshops.title: Training for Community Agents
workshops.description: Training program aimed at people working in migrant communities, providing tools for emotional and cultural accompaniment.

workshops.title: Awareness in Educational Centers
workshops.description: Workshops and talks in schools and institutes to promote cultural diversity, respect and inclusion of migrant children in the educational field.

workshops.title: Workshops for Migration Professionals
workshops.description: Specialized training for professionals working with migrant populations, focused on identity memory, children's rights and intercultural approach.

sustainability.title: Sustainability Approach
sustainability.description: All our workshops incorporate emotional and ecological sustainability practices:
items: Spaces of silence, pause and deep listening
Mutual care practices in all workshops
Outdoor activities that connect nature and memory

beneficiaries.title: Who are these workshops for?
items: Children of migrants born in Spain

contact.title: Interested in our workshops?
contact.description: Contact us for more information about dates, schedules and how to participate
